body:
Hey Anthony,

It looks like a test-only compilation failure. I'm getting a test
environment set up here, and hope to make the fixes shortly.

Craig

On Sun, Aug 16, 2015 at 7:27 PM Andrew Pollock notifications@github.com
wrote:

> This is a reproduction of the bug report at
> https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=795766
> 
> In an ideal world, correpondence including
> 795766-forwarded@bugs.debian.org would keep our bug tracking system in
> the loop.
> 
> Builds of grpc for 32-bit architectures (i386 and powerpc so far) have
> 
> been failing:
> 
>   [C]       Compiling test/core/iomgr/tcp_server_posix_test.c
>   In file included from test/core/iomgr/tcp_server_posix_test.c:39:0:
>   test/core/iomgr/tcp_server_posix_test.c: In function 'test_connect':
>   ./test/core/util/test_config.h:52:3: error: overflow in implicit constant conversion [-Werror=overflow](GRPC_TEST_SLOWDOWN_BUILD_FACTOR * GRPC_TEST_SLOWDOWN_MACHINE_FACTOR)
>      ^
>   ./test/core/util/test_config.h:56:37: note: in expansion of macro 'GRPC_TEST_SLOWDOWN_FACTOR'
>                   gpr_time_from_micros(GRPC_TEST_SLOWDOWN_FACTOR \* 1e6 \* (x)))
>                                        ^
>   test/core/iomgr/tcp_server_posix_test.c:128:16: note: in expansion of macro 'GRPC_TIMEOUT_SECONDS_TO_DEADLINE'
>        deadline = GRPC_TIMEOUT_SECONDS_TO_DEADLINE(4000);
>                   ^
>   cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
>   make[2]: **\* [objs/opt/test/core/iomgr/tcp_server_posix_test.o] Error 1
>   Makefile:2847: recipe for target 'objs/opt/test/core/iomgr/tcp_server_posix_test.o' failed
>   make[2]: Leaving directory '/«PKGBUILDDIR»'
>   make[1]: **\* [override_dh_auto_test] Error 2
>   make: **\* [build-arch] Error 2
>   debian/rules:22: recipe for target 'override_dh_auto_test' failed
>   make[1]: Leaving directory '/«PKGBUILDDIR»'
>   debian/rules:29: recipe for target 'build-arch' failed
>   dpkg-buildpackage: error: debian/rules build-arch gave error exit status 2
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/2950.
This is fixed at head. Still needs to be backported to release 0.10.1
This was fixed in #2985, and include in release 0.10.2
